Identification.LongTitle: Most-Favoured-Nation Tariff Rules of Origin Regulations

Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Finance, pursuant to subsection 16(2) of the Customs Tariffa, hereby makes the annexed Most-Favoured-Nation Tariff Rules of Origin Regulations.

Section.Text: Goods originate in a country that is a beneficiary of the Most-Favoured-Nation Tariff if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 50 per cent of the cost of production of the goods is incurred by the industry of one or more countries that are beneficiaries of the Most-Favoured-Nation Tariff, or by the industry of Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the goods were finished in a country that is a beneficiary of the Most-Favoured-Nation Tariff in the form in which they are imported into Canada.

Section.Text: In calculating the cost of production for the purposes of paragraph 1(a), the following shall not be included:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the cost of outside packing and expenses related to outside packing, required for the transportation of the goods, not including packing in which the goods are ordinarily sold for consumption;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: gross profit of the manufacturer or exporter and the profit or remuneration of any trader, broker or other person dealing in the goods in their finished manufactured condition;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: customs or excise duty or tax paid or payable on imported materials;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: carriage, insurance and other charges from the place of production or manufacture in the country of origin to the port of shipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any other costs or charges incurred or to be incurred subsequent to the completion of the manufacture of the goods.

Section.Text: Goods are entitled to the Most-Favoured-Nation Tariff only if the goods are shipped directly to Canada, with or without transhipment, from a country that is a beneficiary of the Most-Favoured-Nation Tariff.
These Regulations come into force on January 1, 1998.
